resources.string: Play or Pause the Current Track
Skip To the Next Track Without Storing a Preference
Show\'s which mode you are using (Training or Let\'s Run)

The Training mode allows you "train" your music to the pace you want to run at. \nWhere possible the app will automatically work out the beats per minute for your music and assign an initial pace to this. If you think a track is too fast for the pace it is being played for, press the \'Too fast\' button, if it is too slow press the \'Too slow\' button. \nIn this mode the screen will keep the phone unlocked.

This mode allows you to run with songs which already have been associated with your preferred pace. If you didn\'t change any values by pressing \'Too fast\' or \'Too slow\' in the training mode then you will run with the pre-defined values. \nIn this mode the screen will keep the phone unlocked.

Use Settings to set the pace you want to run at. \nMiles(M)/Kilometres(Km) sets whether the app will show and calculate pace in minutes per M or minutes per Km. \nIf you change the M/Km setting then you also need to change the target pace which is the number of minutes it takes you to run one M/Km. If you don\'t know your pace, try the adult default of 10 M or 6 Km, or run one M/Km and time yourself.
Echonest provide the music tempo analysis as licensed at http://www.www.echonest.com. \nBeatYourPace \u00a9 D. Twisleton, 2014. \nDeveloped by L. Barbosa, K. Knevitt, S. Nicholson.

BeatYourPace has been tested for Android 2.3.3 to 4.1.1. \nIt is desiged for runners using phones held in the hand or attached to an armband, it does not support tablet screen resolutions. \nThe screen is locked in portrait and is designed to work for resolutions from 2.7" (240 x 320) to 5.4" (480 x 854).

BeatYourPace is an app for runners that plays music from your phone matched to the pace you want to run at. Running to music at the right tempo can help motivate you to achieve and sustain your desired running pace. 
As every runner is different, the app lets you change the pace set for each music track for the pace you think it is suitable for. 
In the app this is 'training' the music to your running pace, so use the Training mode for this.
Runners told us they don't like to stop to press buttons so the buttons are as large as possible to help you press them without looking at the screen in case you need to change your target pace, or change the tagged pace for a track while you are running.
